    • Constructor Detail

      • fileParse

        public fileParse(java.lang.String path,
         java.lang.String indent,
         java.sql.Connection conn)
        Default/preferred constructor
        Parameters:
        path - The path of where the file/folder is
        indent - How far indented it should be based on the original file
        conn - The connection to the database that's being used

      • fileParse

        public fileParse(java.sql.Connection conn)
        A very confused fallback constructor, should really use "fileParse(String path, String indent, Connection conn)" Could use if created/constructing a file that's not in a normal location... ...or from a script that goes through and adds lots of files all at once.
        Parameters:
        conn - Database connection to be used...

      • fileParse

        public fileParse(java.lang.String path)
        Deprecated. 
        really shouldn't be used, but it's in here just in case...
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file/folder
